preposition.description: Identifying the agent performing an action.
Indicating the means of achieving something.
examples: malaria can be controlled by attacking the parasite
they plan to provide further working capital by means of borrowing

preposition.description: Indicating the amount or size of a margin.
examples: the shot missed her by miles

preposition.description: Indicating a deadline or the end of a particular time period.
examples: I've got to do this report by Monday
by now Kelly needed extensive physiotherapy

preposition.description: Indicating location of a physical object beside a place or object.
examples: remains were discovered by the roadside
the lamp was by the door

preposition.description: Indicating the period in which something happens.
examples: this animal always hunts by night
anything you do is all right by me
she had done her duty by him
it was the least he could do, by God
a car flashed by on the other side of the road
he let only a moment go by

phrases: mammals have, by and large, bigger brains than reptiles
living in that big house by himself
the patient often learns to undress by himself
origin: Old English bī, bi, be, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bij and German bei.
